intro: Leptonychia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf leptonychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Leptonychia lanceolata is often found in open grasslands and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
